alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips; Petroleum; Southwest Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 8:59PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Phillips, northeastern Petroleum and northwestern Garfield Counties through 1000 PM MDT... At 858 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles north of Fourchette to 21 miles west of U L Bend Rec Area to near Crooked Creek Rec Area. Movement was west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fourchette, Devils Creek Rec Area, U L Bend Rec Area, Sun Prairie and Fred Robinson Bridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
